openings.title: Caro-Kann Defence
openings.description: A solid reply to 1.e4. Black fights for the centre with pawns on c6 and d5, keeping a sound pawn structure and developing the light-squared bishop outside the pawn chain.

moves.comment: White opens with the King's pawn, controlling the centre.
The Caro-Kann! Preparing to challenge the centre with ...d5 next move.
White claims more central space with both pawns.
Black strikes at e4 immediately. The point of 1...c6 — the d5-pawn is supported.
White defends the e4-pawn with the knight — the Classical Variation.
Black captures, opening the diagonal for the light-squared bishop.
White recaptures with the knight, centralising it powerfully.
The signature move! Developing the bishop outside the pawn chain before playing ...e6.
White attacks the bishop, forcing it to decide where to go.
The bishop retreats to a safe diagonal, still active outside the pawn chain.
An aggressive pawn thrust, threatening h5 to trap or trade the bishop.
Preventing h5 for now, giving the bishop a retreat square on h7.
White develops the knight to its natural square, preparing to castle.
Developing the knight to d7 rather than c6, keeping the c-file open and supporting ...e6.
White pushes the h-pawn, displacing the bishop from the g6 diagonal.
The bishop retreats to h7. It looks passive but remains useful after ...Bd3 trades.
White develops the bishop and offers a trade of light-squared bishops.
Black trades bishops. This is fine — White's light-squared bishop was more active.
White recaptures with the queen, centralising it.
Black solidifies the centre and opens the dark-squared bishop's diagonal. A model Caro-Kann position.
